flixel.addons.display.FlxGridOverlay

type
class
FlxGridOverlay

Static Methods

addLegend(Sprite : flixel.FlxSprite, CellWidth : Int, CellHeight : Int, ?AxisX : Bool, ?AxisY : Bool) : flixel.FlxSprite

create(CellWidth : Int, CellHeight : Int, ?Width : Int, ?Height : Int, ?AddLegend : Bool, ?Alternate : Bool, ?Color1 : Int, ?Color2 : Int) : flixel.FlxSprite

parameters
CellWidth The grid cell width
CellHeight The grid cell height
Width The width of the FlxSprite. If -1 it will be the size of the game (FlxG.width)
Height The height of the FlxSprite. If -1 it will be the size of the game (FlxG.height)
AddLegend TODO
Alternate Should the pattern alternate on each new row? Default true = checkerboard effect. False = vertical stripes
Color1 The first fill colour in 0xAARRGGBB format
Color2 The second fill colour in 0xAARRGGBB format
returns
FlxSprite of given width/height
Creates an FlxSprite of the given width and height filled with a checkerboard pattern.
Each grid cell is the specified width and height, and alternates between two colors.
If alternate is true each row of the pattern will be offset, for a proper checkerboard style. If false each row will be the same colour, creating a striped-pattern effect.
So to create an 8x8 grid you'd call create(8,8)

createGrid(CellWidth : Int, CellHeight : Int, Width : Int, Height : Int, Alternate : Bool, Color1 : Int, Color2 : Int) : flash.display.BitmapData

overlay(Sprite : flixel.FlxSprite, CellWidth : Int, CellHeight : Int, ?Width : Int, ?Height : Int, ?AddLegend : Bool, ?Alternate : Bool, ?Color1 : Int, ?Color2 : Int) : flixel.FlxSprite

parameters
Sprite The FlxSprite you wish to draw the grid on-top of. This updates its pixels value, not just the current frame (don't use animated sprites!)
CellWidth The grid cell width
CellHeight The grid cell height
Width The width of the FlxSprite. If -1 it will be the size of the game (FlxG.width)
Height The height of the FlxSprite. If -1 it will be the size of the game (FlxG.height)
AddLegend TODO
Alternate Should the pattern alternate on each new row? Default true = checkerboard effect. False = vertical stripes
Color1 The first fill colour in 0xAARRGGBB format
Color2 The second fill colour in 0xAARRGGBB format
returns
The modified source FlxSprite
Creates a checkerboard pattern of the given width/height and overlays it onto the given FlxSprite.
Each grid cell is the specified width and height, and alternates between two colors.
If alternate is true each row of the pattern will be offset, for a proper checkerboard style. If false each row will be the same colour, creating a striped-pattern effect.
So to create an 8x8 grid you'd call create(8,8,
